Light microscope observations carried out on sugar beets susceptible (Kawecora) and tolerant (KWS 37339-4) to infection by Erysiphe betae (Vaha) Weltzien, showed that tolerance may be expressed at various stages in the infection process. The delayed haustorial formation in tolerant beets was correlated with their thicker cuticle. In sugar beets of the same degree of susceptibility to mildew infection, haustorial development was also delayed in older plants respect to younger ones. Because the cuticle thickness was not statistically different in plants of the two ages we tested, it is supposed that the cuticle chemical-physical properties connected with plant age, may also play a role. Lignin accumulation occurred in papillae deposited in tolerant plants. Such lignified papillae were effective in incapsulating the infection peg and in preventing haustorial development. Furthermore, other defense mechanisms were active in determining the distortion and destruction of haustoria in tolerant plants. Extrahaustorial membrane detachment was also often observed. Hypersensitive reactions of infected cells after haustoria had formed, occurred in tolerant hosts.

Magn. was isolated from infected plants and the fungus isolate was tested for its pathogenicity on lettuce. Extracts from three species of marine macroscopic algae collected from the Western coast of Sicily have been examined for antiviral activity against southern bean mosaic virus (SBMV). Only in a brown alga (Cystoseira stricta) a substance which interfers with mechanical transmission of the virus has been discovered. On the contrary no activity has been detected on two green algae (Ulva rigida and Enteromorpha intestinalis). On the basis of polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis tests, the active agent of C. stricta has the caracteristic of a protein.

42567969|Vengono riportati e discussi i risultati di uno studio effettuato al microscopio ottico ed al microscopio elettronico allo scopo di evidenziare eventuali meccanismi morfo-funzionali di resistenza nei confronti del fungo P. tracheiphila, agente del mal secco degli agrumi. Le osservazioni sono state effettuate su piante di arancio amaro (suscettibile) e di limone cvv Monachello (resistente) e Femminello (suscettibile). Esse hanno messo in evidenza che nelle combinazioni resistenti le infezioni rimangono localizzate a settori dello xilema, anche negli stadi pi avanzati del processo di infezione, e vengono circoscritte da tessuto di cicatrizzazione. Quest'ultimo si forma anche nelle combinazioni suscettibili, ma va incontro a degenerazione. Tra le alterazioni strutturali ed ultrastrutturali associate all'infezione alcune hanno carattere degenerativo, altre invece possono essere interpretate come fenomeni di cicatrizzazione e/o di riparazione. Delle modificazioni osservate, soltanto la reazione di tipo gommoso a livello del tessuto conduttore invaso dal patogeno puo essere riguardata come un meccanismo primario di resistenza, dal momento che pu avere la funzione di ritardare la diffusione del patogeno nei tessuti, consentendo alla pianta di mettere in atto altri meccanismi di resistenza. The results of a research made by light and electron microscopy about some morphofunctional resistance mechanisms against the fungus Phoma tracheiphila, the causal agent of citrus  mal secco  disease, are reported and discussed. Observation have been made on sour orange (susceptible), Monachello lemon (resistant) and Femminello lemon (susceptible). They have revealed that in resistant trees infections are confined in sectorial zones of xylem, also in advanced stages of infection process, and that infected tissues are lined by cicatricial structures. These arise also in susceptible trees but undergo degeneration phenomena. Both in susceptible and in resistant trees some of the structural and ultrastructural alterations associated with the infection are degenerative, but some others can be referred to cicatricial and/or reparative phenomena. Among the modifications observed, only gum-like reaction of the conductive tissues invaded by the fungus may be interpreted as a primary resistance mechanism; in fact it can delay spreading of the pathogen into the tissues allowing the plant to react by other mechanisms.

42556774|Su piante di limone cv Femminello con gravi infezioni naturali di Phoma tracheiphila  stata controllata, ad intervalli di 15 gg e per un periodo di 2 anni, la germinabilit delle spore di picnidi differenziati su rametti con infezioni recenti. Nei 2 anni di osservazioni, le pi elevate percentuali di germinazione sono state infatti accertate in coincidenza con i periodi di pioggia. La variabilit nella germinazione delle spore  rilevata fra i picnidi dei vari rametti di uno stesso campionamento  viene attribuita ad una perdita di germinabilit subita dalle spore durante periodi stagionali sfavorevoli. Si formula anche l'ipotesi che essa possa derivare da una non contemporanea maturazione delle spore e/o da una certa gradualit nella differenziazione dei picnidi. On lemon trees cv Femminello, with heavy natural infections of P. tracheiphila, the agent of  mal secco  disease, the germinability of spores of pycnidia differentiated on twigs with recent infections has been ascertained, for two years, at fortnight's interval. The data acquired have allowed to conclude that, although picnidia are present during the whole year, the related spores do not germinate in summer time. Their germinability seems to be related to weather conditions and mainly to rains. The highest percentage of germination has been in fact noticed during wet periods. The variability occured in the percentage of germination among spores of different twigs of each sampling is attribuited to the inactivation of spores during unfavorable seasonal periods. It seems to be likely also that it could be influenced by a not contemporaneous ripening of spores and/or by a certain graduality in the differentiation of pycnidia.

The Authors reported some assay on nutritive requirements about Phacidium sp. in Italy: one stock from Bolzano on Pinus cembra, and one from Sila on P. nigra var. laricio. No significative differences appeared by statistical analysis. A series of growth experiments showed that the optimum for the fungus development was on agar malt extract at 15C, pH 4-6. At temperature of 5 and 25C the mycelium grows very modestly. Growth has been demonstrated at temperature as low as 0C and 18C, specially among the third and the fourth week from incubation. Regards nutrition of carbon and oxigen the fungus like better glucose than saccarose. Some nitrogen source is prefered asparagina than ammonium nitrate. The growth is better on media additive with thiamine than pyrimidine and thiazole.
42556777|Un'ulteriore indagine sulla localizzazione del deperimento delle  Red Delicious   riscontrato in Valtellina fin dal 1965  ha confermato che la malattia ha un'area di diffusione ben delimitata, pur con fluttuazioni nella sua incidenza nell'ambito dei singoli frutteti, e che non interessa le  Golden Delicious . Avendo potuto precedentemente dimostrare che il fenomeno non era attribuibile a cause parassitarie, sono state effettuate prove tendenti a mettere in evidenza eventuali turbe nutrizionali: concimazioni alla chioma e/o al terreno con chelati di ferro, solfato di Cu, borace e concimi complessi; iniezioni nel tronco con soluzioni di vari elementi nutritivi. In tutti i casi non sono stati ottenuti miglioramenti apprezzabili delle piante in deperimento. La presenza di piccole aree necrotiche nella corteccia, accompagnate da leggere tumefazioni in corrispondenza della superficie esterna (internal bark necrosis), e la mancata reazione delle piante alle concimazioni con borace hanno fatto ritenere potersi trattare di fenomeni di tossicit da Mn. Dalle analisi dei compioni di terreno provenienti dai frutteti ammalati  risultato che il contenuto in Mn non era elevato. Si  invece potuto accertare che il contenuto in Ca era notevolmente basso e il pH tendenzialmente acido, due condizioni che favoriscono i fenomeni di tossicit da Mn. Le analisi della corteccia e quelle delle foglie (quest'ultime ripetute per tre anni consecutivi) hanno dimostrato che nelle piante  Red Delicious  delle aree della Valtellina interessate al deperimento il contenuto in Mn era elevato. Ci sia nel caso di piante adulte che di giovani piante clonali messe a dimora in due frutteti sperimentali istituiti nella zona. In analoghe piante clonali allevate in un frutteto sperimentale del Trentino (testimone), i contenu ti in Mn erano invece notevolmente pi bassi. Somministrazioni di Ca al terreno, effettuate in vari frutteti della Valtellina, hanno indotto abbassamenti cospicui nei contenuti in Mn delle foglie delle piante  Red Delicious  e, nel caso delle giovani piante clonali, anche ad aumenti significativi nei contenuti in Ca. Nel caso di piante con sintomi iniziali di deperimento, si sono potuti registrare fenomeni di ripresa in; seguito a calcitazioni al terreno. Gli elementi acquisiti sembrano indicare che il deperimento delle  Red Delicious  della Valtellina  da attribuire a tossicit da Mn. A further survey on the location of the  Red Delicious  decline detected since 1965 in Valtellina, has confirmed that the disease has a well defined area; nevertheless within the single orchards fluctuations in its incidence are present. As in previous researches it was possible to exclude parasitic agents as primary cause of the disease, trials to prove a possible nutritional disorder have been carried out, i.e. fertilizing the canopy or to the soil with iron chelates, copper sulphate, borax and complex manures and injecting trunks with solutions of various nutrients. In any case no appreciable improvement in the declining trees was obtained. The presence of small internal necrotic spots and external swellings on the bark (of the type known as internal bark necrosis) and the lack of any response to the B- manuring have suggested the hypothesis that the phenomenon could be due to Mn toxicity. From the analyses of soil samples collected in several orchards where affected trees were present, it was noticed that their Mn content was not very high. It was found, on the other hand, that the Ca contents were very low and pH rather acid. Both conditions are known to favour the Mn toxicity phenomena. Bark and leaf analyses (the latter repeated consecutively for three years) have proved that in the  Red Delicious  trees of the Valtellina areas affected by the decline phenomena, Mn content was high, both in adult trees and in young clonal ones planted in the same orchards. In analogous clonal apple trees grown in another fruit area (control) Mn content was, on the other hand, quite low. By adding Ca hydrate to the soil of various orchards of Valtellina, a marked lowering in the Mn content of the leaves of the  Red Delicious  trees has been obtained. In the case of the young clonal trees, a significant increase in the Ca contents of the tissues has been also found. In trees in the first stage of decline, recovery has been observed beginning a year after the application of Ca hydrate. The results seem to prove that the primary cause of  Red Delicious  decline in Valtellina is a Mn toxicity connected with the peculiar soil conditions that area where the disease was detected.
42556778|In cloroplasti, giovani o gi differenziati, e in leucoplasti di viticci, tralci e foglie di vite (Vitis vintfera)  provenienti sia da piante sane che da piante affette da suberosi corticale e accartocciamento fogliare  sono state osservate membrane tilacoidali non normalmente contrastate del tipo  ligthly stained membranes  (LSM). Membrane con analoghe caratteristiche sono state riscontrate in giovani frutti di Citrus aurantium e in frutti in fase di invaiatura di Musa paradisiaca. Il fenomeno potrebbe derivare da squilibri fisiologici nelle varie tappe evolutive dei prastidi o da fatti patologici. Abnormally staining thylakoidal membranes (LSM) have been observed in young or differentiated chloroplasts, and in leucoplasts of tendrils, canes and leaves of grapevine (Vitis vinifera)  both from healthy plants or from plants affected by corky bark or leaf roll. Analogous membranes have been detected in young fruits of Citrus aurantium and ripening fruits of Musa paradisiaca. The phenomenon might therefore be due either to temporany physiological modifications or to patological events.

42556786|Su alcuni esemplari di Fagus sylvatica purpurea Ait., alla base del tronco sono state osservate zone corticali depresse, di forma allungata nel senso dell'asse della pianta. Queste alterazioni sono talvolta facilmente individuabili per la presenza di un essudato acquoso. Su substrati colturali diversi  stata costantemente isolata Phytophthora sp., Pythium middletonii Sparrow sempre associati a Cephalosporium sp. Negli Stati Uniti la malattia  provocata da Phytophthora cactorum ed  frquente su acero, meno su faggio, olmo, betulla e quercia. In Italia, pur essendo conosciuta una moria in vivaio di faggio dovuta alio stesso fungo, non  mai stata segnalata la malattia da noi osservata per la quale si propone il termine di  cancro litico  del faggio. At the base of the trunk of some Fagus sylvatica purpurea Ait., cortical depressed zones in the bark, lengthened in the direction of the axis of the plant, were observed. Sometimes these alterations are more easily located as here a fluid oozes from the tree. Under these spots, the subcortical tissues are darkened and lysed so as to form hollows full of a hyaline, slightly viscous fluid. The microscopic examination of the fluid shows the presence of a large number of zoosporangia of Phycomycetes. In the advanced stages of the disease the bark cracks and the fluid drips down the trunk. On different media Phytophthora sp. always associated with Pythium middle tonii Sparrow and Cephalosporium sp. were constantly isolated. In the United States the disease is caused by P. cactorum and is frequently found on maples, and less so on beeches, elms, birches, oaks, etc. In Italy, although beech seedlings have been attacked by P. cactorum, the disease described here on adult trees and for which we propose the name  cancro litico del faggio  has never been reported.

42556796|Vengono riportati i risultati, delle analisi di laboratorio, ottenuti nel corso di un triennio di esperienze fatte in ambienti e con vitigni diversi. Il micete, Botrytis cinerea, sverna per lo pi sotto forma di micelio nei primi tratti del tralcio, corne sclerozio negli ultimi tratti e sempre come micelio nelle gemme e nelle perule. La presenza del micete aumenta sensibilmente dal quarto nodo in poi del tralcio e la sua quantit  in relazione diretta al grado di infezione verificatosi nel vigneto l'autunno precedente. Esso si trova in misura inferiore quando nel vigneto sono stati fatti trattamenti spcifia e per lo pi come sclerozio. L'infezione della gemma  strettamente legata all'infezione delle perule e quella del nodo  in relazione a quella delle gemme. Nelle viti ad uva rossa la sua presenza  sempre stata inferiore rispetto a quelle bianche. Durante le analisi  stata riscontrata un'azione antagonista di Cladosporium nei confronti di Botrytis cinerea. Infine si discute sui risultati ottenuti. Results are reported for the laboratory analyses during three years of research with different vines and environmental conditions. The mycete, Botrytis cinrea, overwinters mostly in the form of mycelium in the lower sections of branches, of sclerotium in the upper sections of branches and again of mycelium in the buds and perules. The presence of the mycete increases considerably from the fourth knot of the branch onwards, and the quantity is in direct relation to the degree of infection which occurred in the vineyard the preceding autumn. It is found to a lesser extent when specific treatments have been made on the vines and generally as sclerotium. Bud infection is strictly tied to perule infection and knot infection is in relation to that of the buds. In the red grape vines its presence has always been lower than in the white grape vines. An antagonistic action of Cladosporium to Botrytis cinrea was found during analyses. The results are discussed.

Different fungi and the bacterium Erwinia carotorova (Jones) Bergey et al. var. carotovora Dye have been identified as the causal agent of the decays. Rhizoctonia solani Khn, Pythium ultimum Trow, and Fusarium solani Mart. (Sacc.) emend. Sn. et Hans, were the most common pathogens. Alternaria radicina Meier, Drechsler et Eddy and an unidentified species of Pythium were found more sporadically. The type and the severity of the observed lesions depend more on the environmental conditions, mainly soil humidity and aeration, than on the specific nature of the pathogen.

42556800|Osservazioni effettuate al TEM su foglie di barbabietola da zucchero trattate con cercosporina hanno evidenziato che la fitotossina determina profonde modificazioni del sistema interno di membrane. Il plasmalemma ed il tonoplasto perdono la loro integrit e cos la membrana esterna dei cloroplasti. I tilacoidi appaiono fortemente distorti ed i grana non risolvibili. Dopo la comparsa delle alterazioni descritte, i mitocondri subiscono degenerazione vacuolare ed il nucleo appare deformato, con cromatina precipitata e con membrana esterna rilassata. Le alterazioni descritte si sono riscontrate sia nelle cellule del mesofillo che in quelle del parenchima dei fasci. In quest'ultimo parenchima per, il raggio d'azione della fitotossina dal punto di applicazione,  risultato minore di quello constatato nel mesofillo. Le descritte degenerazioni dei costituenti cellulari erano marcatamente pi intense in foglie mantenute alla luce rispetto a quelle verificatesi in foglie tenute al buio. TEM observations of sugar beet leaves on which a cercosporin solution was applied, revealed that this phytotoxin induces heavy modifications to the inner system of membranes. Plasmalemma, tonoplast and chloroplast membranes became swollen and lost their integrity. Thylakoides were distorted and grana unrisolvible. After those modifications had appeared, mitochondria became vacuolated, the nucleus became irregular in outline, its membrane became swollen and chromatin coalesced. All the descibed modifications were present both in the mesophyll cells and in the parechymatic cells of the vascular bundle. The area of damaged cells around the application point of the phytotoxin was larger in the mesophyll than in the vascular bundle parenchyma. Alterations of cell constituents were strongly increased by light.

Le altre strutture cellulari manifestavano modificazioni meno marcate e comunque di comparsa successiva rispetto aile precedenti. Tra queste modificazioni successive, le pi evidenti si verificavano a carico dei cloroplasti che presentavano tilacoidi in parte distorti, la membrana esterna a volte alterata ed abbondante presenza di plastoglobuli. TEM observations of sugar beet leaves on which CBT (Cercospora beticola toxin) was applied, showed that this phytotoxin acts ciefly on the plasmalemma and on the tonoplast which became swollen and invaginate into vacuoles. Endoplasmic reticulum became swollen too and lost partially its integrity. The other subcellular structures showed less evident modifications which appeared only successively. Among these successive modifications, the most evident were present in the chloroplasts in which thylacoides were partially distorted, the outer membrane was sometimes degraded and several plastoglobuli were present.

42556808|The status of Dutch elm disease in Italy was surveyed by questionnaire. In the summer of 1979 the disease had invaded the whole country but was sporadically present in some of the most northern and southern regions. Very high percentages of attack, often higher than 50, are found in northern regions. By culturally testing about 200 isolates coming from all over the country, the presence of the more aggressive strain of C. ulmi was found everywhere except in Calabria and Sardinia. This strain dominates the fungus population, except in the most southern regions where the less aggressive one takes the advantage. I do not have enough data to state if this situation is stable or in evolution. The classification in culture of the isolates for aggressiveness is complicated because of the presence of more aggressive isolates of Eurasian and American origin. The great majority of the isolates were classed by means of two characters, growth rate and synnemata production, on two cultural media, but for very few isolates which remain dubious some other cultural feature such as presence of aerial mycelium must be considered. By inoculating 11 isolates on 3 clones of Siberian elm a relationship between cultural features and aggressiveness was found and confirmation of the existence of two distinct levels of aggressiveness without intermediate passages was obtained. Con la collaborazione del Corpo Forestale dello Stato  stata fatta una indagine a mezzo scheda sulla situazione della grafiosi in Italia. Nell'estate 1979 la malattia aveva invaso tutto il paese con percentuali di attacco molto alte particolarmente nelle regioni settentrionali mentre era presente sporadicamente in Trentino e nelle estreme regioni meridionali. Da un test colturale eseguito su 200 isolati  risultata la presenza del ceppo pi aggressivo di C. ulmi dall'Alto Adige alla Sicilia; esso domina la popolazione del patogeno tranne che nelle regioni pi meridionali dove il ceppo meno aggressivo  pi abbondante. Non ho pero dati sufficienti per dire se questa sia una situazione bilanciata e quindi stabile. La classificazione in coltura degli isolati per l'aggressivit  complicata per la presenza nel ceppo aggressivo di isolati di origine  euroasiatica  ed  americana . La maggioranza degli isolati fu classificata per mezzo di due caratteri, crescita della colonia e produzione di coremi, rilevati su due substrati, ma per pochi isolati che rimasero dubbi si dovette considerare anche la presenza di micelio aereo. Prove di inoculazione di 11 isolati su 3 cloni di olmo siberiano confermarono la classificazione in coltura e l'esistenza di due distinti livelli di aggressivit senza passaggi intermedi.
42556809|Senescent leaves of Gomphrena globosa fed for prolonged periods with tap water developed spontaneous necrotic lesions, virus-like in appearance but not of pathogens origin. Three apparently new proteins appeared in such leaves, but they were absent in similar senescent leaves from which lesions were removed. These proteins had the same migration rate of three proteins produced during the hypersensitive reaction of G. globosa leaves to viruses. Two other proteins, whose accumulation was strongly stimulated following the hypersensitive reaction to viruses, were normal components of senescent leaves. This represents the first report indicating a parallel between the effect of mineral deficiency leading to tissue necrosis and senescence, and the hypersensitive reaction to viruses on host-pratein metabolism. Foglie senescenti di Gomphrena globosa mantenute a lungo su acqua e Agriperlite, svilupparono lesioni necrotiche spontanee, molto simili a quelle indotte da virus, ma non dovute ad infezioni da patogeni. Tre proteine, non presenti nei tessuti senescenti non portanti tali lesioni, furono evidenziate in foglie portanti lesioni spontanee. Tali proteine mostrarono la stessa velocit di migrazione in seguito ad elettroforesi su geli di poliacrilamide, di tre proteine prodotte durante la reazione ipersensibile di foglie di G. globosa a virus. Altre due proteine, il cui accumulo risulto fortemente stimolato in seguito a reazione ipersensibile a virus, risultarono normali componenti di tessuti fogliari senescenti. Questo lavoro  la prima segnalazione indicante un parallelismo tra gli efetti di carenza minrale inducente senescenza e necrosi tissutale e gli effetti della reazione ipersensibile a virus, sul metabolismo proteico dell'ospite.
42556810|La sierologia, tradizionalmente impiegata per studi tassonomici e diagnostici di virus, batteri e vari funghi patogeni per l'uomo, oltre che di lieviti e di altri organismi,  oggi applicata con successo in micologia anche all'analisi antigenica di generi, specie ed entit subspecifiche. Nella controversa sistematica del genere Fusarium le tecniche immunologiche possono fornire un utile complemento al metodo morfologico classico. Il test pi adoperato negli studi sui Fusaria  quello della diffusione doppia in agar, anche se recentemente si  affermato quello della immunoelettroforesi. Con la tecnica della immunodiffusione  stato possibile, tra l'altro, confermare raffinit tassonomica tra F. oxysporum e F. moniliforme, oltre ad ottenere una convalida delle vedute di Snyder e Hansen sulla costituzione della specie F. roseum. Con il metodo della immunoelettroforesi bidimensionale sono state inquadrate, sulla base delle affinit sierologiche, le specie delle sezioni  Gibbosum  e  Discolor  ed  stata confermata l'ipotesi di Booth sulla composizione della sezione  Gibbosum . Pareri discordi esistono ancora sulla possibilit di impiegare la sierologia per il riconoscimento di entit subspecifiche isomorfe quali le formae speciales. Gli autori di questa rassegna, utilizzando la tcnica dell'immunodiffusione doppia, sono riusciti a distinguere alcune formae speciales e razze di fusarium oxysporum, oltre a diverse specie di Fusarium, servendosi di antigeni resi solubili con l'uso del Triton. Hanno inoltre evidenziato, con Taiuto della radio-immunodiffusione doppia, linee di precipitazione invisibili nel gel. Essi intendono, infine, applicare per l'analisi tassonomica del genere Fusarium la metodologia della produzione in vitro di anticorpi monoclonali, alio scopo di selezionare cloni di cellule producenti anticorpi specifici per un singolo determinante. Serology, so far used mainly for the diagnosis and taxonomy of viruses, bacteria and fungi pathogenic for man, is now being used successfully also in mycology for antigenic analysis of genera, species and sub-specific entities. In particular, immunological techniques may complement fruitfully morphological criteria in defining the taxonomy of the genus Fusarium. The test used more frequently for the serological analysis of Fusaria is the double diffusion in agar. By this technique it has been possible to confirm the taxonomic affinity of F. oxysporum and F. moniliforme and the view of Snyder and Hansen on the costitution of the species F. roseum. Immunoelectrophoresis, and in particular bidimensional immunoelectrophoresis, is also being exploited. The latter contributed greatly to define the sections Gibbosum and Discolor and to confirm the hypothesis of Booth on the composition of the section Gibbosum. Disagreement still exists as to the possibility to use serology to distinguish between isomorph sub-specific entities like formae speciales. The authors of the present review succeeded in differentiating by double diffusion between formae spciales as well as between races of F. oxysporum. For this purpose they used antigens extracted by Triton. They have also developed a high sensitive radio double diffusion assay, which allows identification on autoradiogram of precipitin lines not visible in agar. In the near future, the same authors plane to apply to the taxonomy of the genus Fusarium the methodology of in vitro production of monoclonal antibodies: monoclonal antibodies, specific as they are for one single epitope, appear in fact the ideal reagent for this purpose.

42556815|In ultrathin sections of leafroll infected grapevines cv. Barbera, growing in Northern Italy, aggregates of very elongated, flexuous particles were observed. 42556818|Pepper plants (Quadrato d'Asti) uninoculated or inoculated with a virulent isolate (P1) and with two avirulent isolates (M1 and M2) of Verticillium, were analyzed periodically for polyphenols and for polyphenol oxidase (PPO) and peroxidase (PO) activity in a study of pathogenesis in Verticillium wilt of pepper. 42556819|L'andamento del Potenziale d'inoculo (PI) di Botrytis cinrea Pers.  stato studiato per tre anni consecutivi in un vigneto dell'Italia settentrionale, dalla meta di maggio alla fine della vendemmia, mediante un captaspore. Le nombre lev de conidies remarqu pendant ces stades phenologiques pendant les trois annes de la recherche doit tre rapport surtout  l'augmente susceptibilit de l'hte. The fluctuation in inoculum potential (IP) of Botrytis cinerea Pers. was studied for three successive years in a vineyard in Northern Italy, from the middle of May to the end of harvest, by means of a spore trap. Results are related to phenological stages, rainfall, temperature and biological environment. An increase in IP was found in connection with flowering and veraison; the maximum occured at harvest time. The high number of spores, noted during the above-mentioned phenological stages during three years, can be mainly attributed to the greater susceptibility of the host. Rainfall contributes to spore dispersal and positively influences the number of conidia trapped. However, if it continues, the IP diminishes. Rain, by creating favourable conditions for infection, indirectly influences IP and this action is more marked when it coincides with moments of high susceptibility. In addition temperature does not greatly influence IP. As B. cinerea is able to attack many weeds, IP reflects also the endemic infections of these. Finally the action of epiphytic microorganisms on the outcome of B. cinerea infections in considered.
42556820|In this paper an attempt to apply an energetic approach to physiopathological studies is presented. Energy balance alterations induced by TMV infection in Nicotiana tabacum L. cv. Xanthi-nc were observed by measuring leaf surface temperature, transpiration rate and the energy exchange between leaves and surrounding environment, under controlled laboratory conditions. Leaf surface temperature was measured by IR thermography and was found to be about 0.5C higher in infected than in healthy leaves during daytime, and about 0.5C lower during the night. Transpiration rate was found to be considerably higher in infected leaves, compared with healthy ones, especially in darkness. Approrimately 2.5% higher energy dispersion in infected leaves was found, in comparison with healthy ones. Results are discussed with reference to the most likely physiological processes involved. Il presente studio costituisce un tentativo di applicare un approccio energtico ad indagini di fisiopatologia vegetale. Si sono studiate le alterazioni indotte dall'infezione necrotica localizzata da TMV nel bilancio energetico fogliare di Nicotiana tabacum L. cv Xanthi-nc. A questo scopo si sono misurati la temperatura superficial delle foglie, il tasso di traspirazione e lo scambio di energia in forma fisica (radiazione, conduzione, convenzione) tra foglie e ambiente circos tante, in condizioni controllate di laboratorio. La temperatura fogliare  stata misurata per termografia infrarossa (nella banda tra 2 e 5.6 micron) ed  risultata di circa 0.5C pi alta nelle foglie inoculate che in quelle sane durante il giorno, e di circa 0.5C pi bassa durante la notte. Il tasso di traspirazione  risultato considerevolmente pi alto nelle foglie infette, soprattutto al buio, mentre alla luce le differenze tendevano ad appiattirsi. Complessivamente nelle foglie inoculate si  trovata una dispersione di energia di circa il 2.5% pi alta che nei controlli. Questa maggiore dispersione puo essere spiegata, alla luce del bilancio energetico fogliare, con un incremento nella disponibilit energtica della foglia (per incremento delle voci in en trata nel bilancio, e cio radiazione assorbita ed energia chimica liberata), oppure con un decremento del consumo di energia in altre forme (essenzialmente per diminuzione dell'accumulo di energia chimica). Peraltro un caso non eselude l'altro, e si ritiene anzi pi probabile che entrambi i fenomeni si verifichino simultaneamente. Nel caso di un incremento di disponibilit energtica, si dovrebbe pensare che nelle foglie infette localmente da TMV si verifichi o un aumento del coefficiente di assorbimento della radiazione incidente (di cui peraltro non risulta alcuna conferma sperimentale, ma piuttosto alcune, sia pure indirette, smentite), o un aumento del metabolismo ossidativo (o esoergonico) in generale (riportato da diversi au tori sia per quanto riguarda la respirazione mitocondriale che altre vie enzimatiche, in particolare enzimi ossidasici connessi con la localizzazione dell'infezione e con la necrogenesi). Nel caso di un decremento del consumo energetico, si deve ipotizzare una diminuzione dell'accumulo di energia chimica per depressione della fotosintesi, che diversi autori hanno riscontrato sperimentalmente, ma che, da un punto di vista quantitativo, non sembra in grado, da sola, di bilanciare lo squilibrio energtico osservato. Viene svolta un'analisi critica dei fenomeni osservati.
42556821|In un agrumeto della Sicilia orientale  stata riscontrata la presenza di giovani piante di limone cv Femminello affette da un grave deperimento. A decline of 12-year-old lemon trees (C. lemon Burm.), apparently identifiable with shell bark, has been observed in a citrus orchard of western Sicily. The disease is characterized by longitudinal cracks of the bark above the grafting, followed by necrosis and shelling. The largest branches may be affected. Foliage becomes sparse, pale and dies. The fungus Phomopsis citri Fawcett has been isolated from the affected tissues of the bark. Artificial inoculations of the isolate on young lemon plants grafted on sour orange (C. aurantium L.), have induced decline phenomena, defolation and die-back. It is believed that the isolate is characterized by high pathogenicity and that, under favourable environmental conditions, could be considered as the causal agent of the disease detected in the citrus orchard.

42556824|Changes in peroxidase (PO) and polyphenoloxidase (PPO) isoenzyme patterns in both TMV-inoculated and opposite uninoculated, resistant, half leaves of N. glutinosa were investigated at different times after inoculation. No qualitative changes in the PO isoenzyme spectrum were observed in relation to leaf infection and/or induced resistance. Associated with local lesion appearance, two iso-PO with Rf 0.047 and 0.14 respectively were activated. Their increased activity remained unchanged until the complete lesion maturation, and a direct correlation between the activation of the 0.14 iso-PO and the severity of the necrotic process was found. An enhanced activity of two PO isoenzymes (Rf 0.14 and 0.23) was observed in resistant tissues. Neither qualitative nor significant quantitative changes in the isopolyphenoloxidase pattern with time were found in inoculated half leaves and in opposite resistant halves. The role of PO and PPO and the involvement of some PO isoenzymes in the hypersensitive reaction, in the normal and virus-induced senescence, and in the induction of systemic acquired resistance are discussed. A series of transmission trials of the barley yellow dwarf virus (BYDV) with the aphid species Rhopalosiphum padi (L.), Sitobion avenae (F.), Metopolophium dirhodum (Wlk) and Rhopalosiphum maidis (Fitch) has been conducted. The research had the aim to prove the presence in Italy of different strains of the virus, as well as to ascertain the transmission efficiency of the four species of aphids used. Trials were carried out in controlled conditions. Sources of inoculum were different gramineae showing evident symptoms of BYDV, collected in fields in various Italian localities. Data aquired allow to deduce that several specific strains of BYDV, i.e. RPV, MDV and MAV, connected, respectively, with the vectors R. padi, M. dirhodum and S. avenae are present in Italy. At least one aspecific strain, transmitted by different species of aphids in present. A series of single parallel transmissions of BYDV has proved that the most efficient species of aphid is R. padi, followed by S. avenae and M. dirhodum. R. maidis resulted as an occasional vector of the virus. The more common strains of BYDV in our sources of inoculum were consequently connected with R. padi and S. avenae. The high percentage of aspecific transmissions gained can be explained by the presence of mixed infections. The existence of different strains of BYDV and its relationships with some aspects of the epidemiology of the disease is discussed.
42556835|Sono state condotte prove in vitro per valutare l'azione fungitossica di Captafol, Carbendazim, Mancozeb ed ossicloruro di rame nei confronti di Ceratocystis fimbriata f. platani. Nel saggio per diffusione in agar la minima dose efficace  stata di 8 ppm per il Carbendazim, 62,5 ppm per il Captafol e 250 ppm per il Mancozeb. Copper oxychloride showed no activity against the fungus.
42556836|The behaviour of mixed populations of sensitive and dicarboximide-resistant strains of Botrytis cinrea Pers. was studied, under greenhouse conditions, on tomato plants artificially inoculated with a mixture of sensitive and resistant strains of the pathogen during two experimental trials. Two different ratio of sensitive and resistant strains in the mixed population were used: 99:1 in the first experiment, 90:10 in the second one, in order to simulate the appearance and successive spreading of resistance in nature. Different spray programmes were used in order to evaluate their effectiveness on disease control: weekly sprays with vinclozolin (30 or 40 g/100 1 of a.i.) reduced significantly the severity of Botrytis rot. Less interesting results were obtained by spraying weekly with dichlofluanid (100 g/100 1 of a.i.) or with vinclozolin every three weeks. From a large percentage of infected fruits collected in vinclozolin treated plots, dicarboximide-resistant strains were isolated. Very few resistant strains were reisolated from rotted fruits collected in untreated plots 2 months after inoculation. This suggests that resistant strains decline in the mixed population probably because of their slightly reduced virulence and rate of growth; the few of them able to infect tomato fruits and to survive in natural conditions were still at least partially controlled by dicarboximides under our experimental conditions. Firstly, a series of single successive transmissions with the aphid Rhopalosiphum padi (L.) have been conducted. Afterwards, using the same source of inoculum (Avena byzantina K.B.O.), other three series of single, successive transmissions with three species of vectors, i.e. R. padi, Sitobion avenae (F.), and Metopolophium dirhodum (Wlk), have been carried out. For the latter trials, 11 serial transmissions, six of them repeated using all the three species of aphids, have been executed. Altogether nine different transmission combinations have been established. Compearing the results acquired in our trials with R. padi and S. avenae with the range of transmissibility of the known strains of BYDV, we can exclude the presence in our isolate of RPV and MAV specific strains. The uninterrupted efficiency noticed for the three different species of vectors along the different transmission lines, as well as the relative constancy of date gained in all the transmission combinations introduced in the experiment confirm the presence in rice plants of an aspecific strain of BYDV. This fact would explaine the severity and diffusion of the disease stated in Italy in the last period. Of course it does not exclude that in the rice cultivations may be present also specific strains of BYDV and mainly, RPV.

Predicted stage (st) of development is given by st =   + st 5 where st 5 is the overwintering dormant stage and st 12 is that when ascospores are mature. Development of pseudothecia and ascospore maturation were predicted sufficiently well taking as moisture threshold level of rainfall  0.25 mm and hours of 85% relative humidity  8 or 12. 42556856|The symptoms of a serious kiwi fruit (Actinidia chinensis Planchon) rot observed over the last years in Italy and occurring in cold storage are briefly described. Pathogenicity tests, carried out in different ways on cold stored fruits, have demonstrated that Batrytis cinerea Pers. is the causal agent of the rot. Other fungi, such as Fusarium sulphureum, Penicillium brevicompactum, Penicillium sp., Rhizopus sp., Ulocladium consortiale, Phoma glomerata and Cladosporium tenuissimum, frequently isolated from pulp and stems of healthy and diseased fruits and from the orchard air, are unable to induce the alteration at 0C. On different media at 0C, only B. cinerea normally grows while the other fungi after a reduced initial growth, do not develop any further. By carrying out isolations from flowers and fruits and using a dicarboximide to protect the fruit at different developmental stages in partial and differential ways, we pointed out that B. cinerea contamination occurs through the flower residues from the end of the blossoming until harvest. Penetration through the wound of the stem, at the moment of harvest, is of secondary importance. Latency of the pathogen, which had penetrated at blossom or during fruit development, can last many months and is interrupted about 30 days after the beginning of cold storage. The first symptoms of the disease appear one month later. Since the pathogen is unable to penetrate unwounded fruit skin, the stored fruits can not be infected by spores and mycelium growing on the surrounding diseased fruits. Viene brevemente descritta la sintomatologia di un grave marciume dei frutti di Actinidia chinensis Planchon che appare durante la conservazione frigorifera. A seguito dei tests di patogenicit realizzati con differenti metodologie su frutti in conservazione,  risultato che l'agente causale  Botrytis cinerea Pers. Altri funghi quali Fusarium sulphureum, Penicillium brevicompactum, Penicillium sp., Rhizopus sp., Ulocladium consortiale, Phoma glomerata e Cladosporium tenuissimum, frequentemente isolati dalla polpa e dai peduncoli di frutti sani od alterati e nell'aria del frutteto, risultano incapaci di indurre a 0C l'alterazione del frutto. Su differenti terreni colturali a 0C solo B. cinerea  in grado di svilupparsi normalmente, mentre la crescita degli altri funghi esaminati  estremamente ridotta. Mediante isolamenti da fiori e frutti e utilizzando una dicarbossimide per proteggere in modo parziale e differenziale le varie fasi di sviluppo del frutto  stato possibile porre in evidenza che la contaminazione di B. cinerea avviene fin dall'inizio della fioritura ma pu realizzarsi, per il tramite dei residui fiorali, anche in tempi successivi fino alla raccolta dei frutti. La penetrazione attraverso la ferita del peduncolo al momento del distacco del frutto  di importanza limitata. La latenza del patogeno, penetrato al momento della fioritura o durante lo sviluppo del frutto, pu durare molti mesi e si interrompe circa trenta giorni dopo l'inizio della conservazione frigorifera mentre i primi sintomi risultano evidenti dopo altri trenta giorni. L'incapacit del patogeno di penetrare direttamente l'epidermide integra del frutto impedisce in frigorifero la diffusione della malattia da frutti malati a frutti sani non danneggiati.
42556857|An isometric virus, isolated from grapevine in Italy, was characterized and identified as arabis mosaic virus (ArMV). Mentre i pesi molecolari delle proteine e degli acidi nucleici sono risultati identici a quelli del ceppo tipo, differenze sono state riscontrate nella sintomatologia su piante test, nel frazionamento in gradiente di densit e nel comportamento sierologico. Si ritiene pertanto ehe l'isolato da vite sia da considerare un ceppo di ArMV diverso dal ceppo tipo.

42556859|Operando con un ceppo ben definito (RGV-76), afide-aspecifico, del virus del nanismo giallo dell'orzo (BYDV),  stato possibile stabilire che la lunghezza del periodo di incubazione della malattia in piante di Avena byzantina K. Cock varia da 9 a 23 giorni. Mediante una triplice serie di 13 trasmissioni successive, condotte con gli afidi vettori Rhopalosiphum padi (L.), Sitobion avenae (F.) e Metopolophium dirhodum (Wlk.)  stato anche possibile constatare che la specie di afide pi efficiente nella trasmissione di BYDV, R. padi, ha indotto nelle piante test di A. byzantina periodi di incubazione della malattia pi brevi, rispetto a quelli osservati nelle trasmissioni con le altre due specie di afidi prese in considerazione. Si  invece esclusa un'eventuale influenza su PMI della malattia derivante dalla specie di afide vettore che aveva inoculato le piante sorgenti d'inoculo. La differente lunghezza di PMI della malattia, in funzione della specie di afide vettore, viene correlata alla quantit di virus inoculato da ciascuna specie vettrice nei tessuti della pianta ospite. Vengono anche menzionate le conseguenze negative di un accorciamento di PMI della malattia, sia ai fini della diffusione naturale di RGV ehe per la maggior entit dei danni ehe esso pu indurre in condizioni di campo. Working with a well known aphid-aspecific strain (RGV-76) of barley yellow dwarf virus (BYDV), it was possible to establish that the length of the incubation period of the disease in Avena byzantina K. Cock can vary from 9 to 23 days. Through a three time series of 13 successive transmissions, with the aphid species Rhopalosiphum padi (L.), Sitobion avenae (F.) and Metopolophium dirhodum (Wlk.), it was also possible to state that the most efficient aphid species for BYDV transmission, i.e. R. padi, has induced in A. byzantina the shortest median incubation period (MIP) of the disease in respect to those observed for the other two species of vectors tested. On the contrary our trials have excluded an eventual influence on MIP of the disease deriving from the species of aphids that had inoculated the plants source of inoculum. The different length of MIP of the disease in function of the aphid species is correlated to the quantity of virus inoculated by each vector species into the healthy plant tissues. In the paper are also emphasized the negative consequences related to a reduction in length of MIP of the disease, both for what concerns its natural spread and the heavier damages induced to the affected plants in field conditions.

42556865|Ten-to one hundred-fold increases in rainwater acidity have been recorded since '70s in many countries of the Northern hemisphere. To test for the effects that precipitation pH may have upon the growth of cereals, seedlings of Wheat (Triticum sativum cv. Mec), Barley (Hordeum vulgare cv. Arma), Oat (Avena sativa cv. Argentina) and Triticale (xTriticale exaploide cv. Mizar) were grown in the greenhouse and exposed to simulated sulphuric rain at pH 5.6 (control), 4.5 and 3.5. No foliar tissue damage was observed, but significant biomass decreases were encountered at pH 3.5. Growth analysis showed that early growth stages are more susceptible to the acidic stress. Aumenti di 10-100 volte nell'acidit dell'acqua di pioggia sono stati registrati sin dagli anni '70 in molti Paesi dell'emisfero settentrionale. Per verificare gli effetti che il pH delle precipitazioni pu avere sullo sviluppo dei cereali, giovani piante di Frumento (Triticum sativum cv. Mec), Orzo (Hordeum vulgare cv. Arma), Avena (Avena sativa cv. Argentina) e Triticale (Triticale exaploide cv. Mizar) sono state allevate in serra e esposte a pioggia solforica simulata a pH 5.6 (contrallo), 4.5 e 3.5. Nessun sintomo fogliare  stato osservato, ma significative riduzioni di biomassa sono state osservate sulle piante trattate con pH 3.5. L'analisi di crescita ha dimostrato che gli stadi precoci di crescita risultano i pi suscettibili allo stress acidico.
42556866|Changes in cathodic and anodic isoperoxidases of two onion cultivars healthy and infected with Botrytis allii were observed. Experiments showed that such increase originated from the release of pre-existing peroxidase. In due cultivars di cipolla, sane ed infettate con Botrytis allii sono stati osservati cambiamenti sia nelle isoperossidasi catodiche che anodiche. La cultivar bianca, meno suscettibile, ha mostrato di possedere un pi ricco corredo di isoperossidasi rispetto alia cultivar rossa. Il trattamento dei tessuti di cipolla con poligalatturonasi di B. allii non aveva alcun effetto sul contenuto di fenoli, mentre determinava un significativo incremento dell'attivit perossidasica. Gli esperimenti hanno messo in evidenza che tale incremento  originato dal rilascio di perossidasi preesistente.
42567979|The effect of barley yellow dwarf virus on the forage yield of twenty five varieties belonging to five hearbage grass species was studeid in a glasshouse experiment. The species tested were: perennial and Italian ryegrass, Timothy grass, meadow fescue and cocksfoot. All varieties tested, except Premo perennial ryegrass were susceptible to infection. The susceptibility differed from species to species and from variety to variety. The least and most resistant species were Timothy grass and perennial ryegrass respectively. Considerable recovery was noticed in the majority of the tested varieties after the first cutting, being more striking in the species Italian ryegrass, meadow fescue and cocksfoot.
42567980|Twelve Italian ecotypes and varieties of alfalfa (Medicago sativa L.) have been subjected to chronic (15 days) fumigations with SO (80 pph), NO (120 ppb) and a mixture of SO and NO (80 and 120 ppb, respectively) and to acute fumigations with O (250 ppb, 4 h), SO (660 ppb, 3 h), NO (1350 ppb, 3 h) and a mixture of SO and NO (600 and 1350 ppb respectively, 3 h). The chronic treatment with SO significantly reduced the growth (in terms of total dry weight in comparison with filtered air controls) of vars. Cody and Semyrtchenskaia and of ecotype Romagnolo, although the plants showed only very mild symptoms (chlorosis). A complete lack of correlation between the responses of the strains to acute and chronic exposure to SO was found. This implies that short term studies with high concentrations are not suitable for evaluating the effects of long-term exposures to the lower concentrations common in polluted areas. A chronic pretreatment with SO or NO resulted in a significant reduction of sensitivity of var. Cane to a successive acute fumigation with the same pollutant. Similar responses have to a lesser extent been observed in other strains. Acute and chronic treatments with NO had little effect, but the mix treatments (SO + NO) gave rise to synergistic (more than additive) interactions in two strains with chronic fumigations, and in nine stranis with acute fumigations. No antagonism between SO and NO has been observed. Difficulties in predicting the environmental impact of air pollution may arise because of the wide variability in responses to different pollutant treatments that exists even between strains of a single plant species. Dodici ecotipi italiani e variet di erba medica (Medicago sativa L.) sono stati sottoposti in condizioni controllate a fumigazioni croniche (15 gg.) con SO (80 ppb), NO (120 ppb) e una miscela di SO e NO (80 e 120 ppb, rispettivamente), nonch a esposizioni acute con O (250 ppb, 4 h), SO (660 ppb, 3 h), NO (1350 ppb, 3 h), e una miscela di SO e NO (660 e 1350 ppb, rispettivamente, 3 h). La fumigazione cronica con SO ha ridotto significativamente lo sviluppo (in termini di peso secco totale rispetto ai controlli in aria filtrata) dlie var. Cody e Semyrtychenskaia e dell'ecotipo Romagnolo, nonostante la comparsa di sintomi (clorosi) molto lievi. In alcuni casi sono stati rilevati modesti incrementi di sviluppo. Il trattamento acuto con SO ha evidenziato una diversa sensibilit delle piante; non risulta comunque esservi correlazione alcuna tra risposta a esposizioni acute e croniche a questo gas. Ci comporta che indagini a breve termine con dosi elevate non sono utilizzabili per valutare gli effetti di esposizioni prolungate a basse concentrazioni, le quali sono peraltro assai pi realistiche dlie altre. La fumigazione cronica con SO (pretrattamento), ha ridotto significativamente la sensibilit della var. Can ad una successiva esposizione acuta allo stesso gas; risposte nella stessa direzione sono state osservate in diversi altri casi. I trattamenti acuti e cronici con NO hanno avuto soltanto modesti effetti, mentre il pretrattamento a bassa concentrazione ha indotto, anche in quest ocaso nella var. Cane, una condizione di minore sensibilit alla esposizione breve ad alta concentrazione. Sono stati osservati effetti pi che additiyi (sinergici) delle miscele SO + NO; nelle fumigazioni croniche il sinergismo si  manifestato nella var. Ranger e nell'ecotipo Maremmano, mentre nel trattamento acuto si  avuto nel 75% delle piante. Nessun fenomeno di antagonismo tra i due gas  stato osservato. L'esposizione acuta all'O ha consentito di stilare una scala di sensibilit, evidenziando corne le risposte delle piante ai trattamenti con i diversi gas non siano tra loro correlate. Vengono pertanto confermate le difficolt di formulare previsioni circa l'impatto ambintale dell'inquinamento atmosferico in considerazione della notevole variabilit di risposte anche nell'ambito di una singla specie vegetale.
42567981|L'autore ha condotto una serie di osservazioni sulla epidemiologia di Sphaerotheca pannosa var. rosae in Toscana. The author has carried out some observations on the symptomatological evolution and some biological aspects of Sphaerotheca pannosa var. rosae in Tuscany. The evolution of the symtomatology is not in connection with exact values of temperature and humidity, but, when it has started, it goes on till a maximum in July, and it declines when the fungus organizes the sexual form. 42567982|Una serie di indagini tendenti a stabilire l'eventuale presenza e diffusione della sharka o vaiolatura ad anello o Plum pox (PP) in una zona susinicola del Trentino (bassa Valle del Sarca) hanno permesso di accertare che la malattia  tuttora presente nell'area. Le ricerche hanno potuto dimostrare che la Susina di Dr, la cultivar prevalente ed economicamente pi importante nella bassa Valle del Sarca,  molto suscettibile alla malattia. Oltre che una serie di sintomi fogliari, che possono subire nel tempo una notevole evoluzione, l'infezione dell'agente della sharka (PPV) induce in tale cultivar gravi perdite di produzione. Un controllo sistematico condotto all'epoca della raccolta su 51 piante, di quattro diverse zone ad elevata infezione, ha dimostrato che molti frutti (29,9-56,7%) cadono a terra prima della raccolta, altri manifestano gravi deformazioni ed altri ancora presentano anomalie di colore. Indagini sistematiche condotte su 64.867 piante di Susina di Dr  dopo aver definito una serie di sintomi tipo, confermati dal test sierologico ELISA, impiegando l'antisiero specifico per PPV  hanno dimostrato che le infezioni di sharka interessavano circa 18% delle piante. La distribuzione delle piante ammalate  per molto variabile a seconda delle zone dell'area frutticola e l'incidenza media pu oscillare dallo 0,1% al 20%, con punte fino al 67%. Focolai di infezioni sono stati riscontrati anche in due vivai della zona. Esaminando comparativamente lo stato sanitario di n. 75 polloni di Susina di Dr trapiantati da cinque anni in un frutteto di una delle zone con maggiore incidenza della malattia con polloni e piante adulte di un'area isolata e non infetta da sharka, dalla quale proveniva tale materiale di moltiplicazione, si  potuto dimostrare che PPV ha nella Valle del Sarca una diffusione naturale abbastanza rapida. Tale constatazione  confermata dalla presenza su molte piante della zona di gravi infestioni di diverse specie di afidi, note come efficienti vettori del virus. Osservazioni dei sintomi ed esami sierologici hanno permesso di individuare un'area collinare isolata e senza recenti impianti di drupacee ed un nucleo di piante selezionate esenti da sharka, ove poter attingere materiale di moltiplicazione per la Susina di Dr. A series of trials and observations have proved that plum pox (PP) or sharka disease is still present and rather diffused in a plum area of the Trento Province (Sarca Valley). The research has made evident that the Dr Plum (Susina di Dr), the most important variety of the Valley is very susceptible to sharka disease. Moreover than a series of leaf symptoms, the agent of plum pox (PPV) induces in such a plum cultivar a heavy loss of the yield. Checking at the harvest period 51 plum trees in four different zones with heavy infections of the disease, it was possible to state that in the affected trees a high percentage of fruits (ranging from 29,9 to 56,7) fall prematurely, other fruits appear malformed and others show an irregular colour. Systematical surveys carried out on 64,867 trees of the Dr Plum variety in the low Sarca Valley have demonstrated that the average incidence of plum pox disease is about 8%. Average distribution of the affected trees is quite variable according to the different zones of the plum area and can fluctuate between 0.1 and 20%, till 67%. A few infections have been noticed also in two nurseries. Field surveys have been carried out after defining on the Dr Plum a series of type symptoms, confirmed by serological tests (ELISA). Examining the sanitary state of 75 rooted sprouts of Dr Plum planted in 1980 in an orchard of one of the most infected zones of the plum area in comparison with rooted sprouts and trees of an isolate area without any sharka infections, from which the former were coming, it was possible to demonstrate that PPV has in the Valley a rather quick natural diffusion. Such statement is supported by the fact that on many trees of the plum area the main aphid species known as efficient vectors of PPV have been detected. Periodical field surveys for excluding the eventual appearance of symptoms and serological tests have allowed to discover the existence of two hillside isolate areas of Dr Plum to utilize for the future multiplications.

42556880|Sono stati indagati fenomeni di eteroauxonia, vale a dire alterazioni nello sviluppo di alcune colonie di ceppi virulenti di Endothia parasitica. 42556881|The author examines the experimental and teaching contents used in two subjects: physiological plant pathology (PhPP) and plant pathology (PP). Aetiological studies have led to teaching the subjects following microbial, mycological or viral classification in the description of diseases. The author has never approved of such procedures. Indeed in his university course on PP, he has followed a diagnostic key grouping the diseases according to their symptoms and the physiological changes induced. The author maintains that also the course on PhPP should give a detailed description of the processes altered in a determinate group of diseases and not just consist of a discussion which pursues chemical equations of the affected cell. The topic of pathogenesis (penetration of the pathogen, predisposing conditions etc.) is part of PP. The pathogenic process (invasion of the tissues, reaction of the plant, susceptibility and immunity) comes under the heading of PhPP. In regard to the subject of immunity the author refutes the search for a comparison, in part or in whole, with that of warm blooded animals where the humoral process called antibody production acts. Phagocytosis of vertebrates cannot be compared with the phenomenon of the same name in plants. The function of plant lectins cannot be extended to include the purpose of immunization just as analagous glycoproteins of invertebrates are not considered immunity factors by zoologists. The author examines the evolution of plants showing how, with the appearance of the Angiosperms, for the first time histo-cytological and biochemical protection processes were acquired (lignin, suberin, callose and cutin) together with a physiological and metabolic transformation of the flowering green plant. In his opinion it is imprecise to define this process as aspecific and he gives his reasons. Furthermore, in plants, the power of regeneration is evolved while it is lost in the transition from invertebrates to vertebrates. An examination of plant antimicrobial metabolites indicates that the first make their appearance in the higher Angiosperms (Dicotyledons). Phytoalexins have great chemical diversity and the hypersensitivity reaction takes place whatever the pathogen (from bacteria to viruses). Many stages in this reaction are common to stress or post-infection resistance phenomena. The author explains this aspecificity as omnipotent protection against everything and everyone which gravitates towards plants for food or vital necessities. The base for any theory of immunity, in his opinion, must be found in evolutionary studies obviously in addition to those on physiology, cytology and biochemistry of plants.
42556884|Taxa in natural systematics are separated according to the idea of grouping that is putting together organisms which in some ways resemble each other, having common characteristics which can be enumerated and designated. The choice of characters is objective in the sense that it is made excluding the feelings of the operator and considering only the fact that they are common to the individuals which make up the taxon, beginning from the species level. The etymological meaning of species is appearance and justly the first examined characters are morphological and ecological ones. The species, the basic taxon of the Systema naturae of Linnaeus, presents two kinds or reasons for variability: an extrinsic one due to the increase in our knowledge, and an intrinsic one in that it soon became evident that the organisms can change external appearance and habits in successive generations. Classifications made by post linnaean naturalists provided an opportune representation of the world of living organisms and the author maintains that there are no legitimate reasons for abandoning or destroying the system created. In relation to the reasons for variability in the species, mentioned above, the author recalls the principle of permanence of the rules of calculus dictated by the mathematician C.F. Gauss: when a definition from the outstart fails we can ask ourselves what would be consequent in order to remain consistent with the created system. The author developes this concept with examples taken from mathematical calculus. The subdivisions of the species meet with the difficulty produced by variability. The author illustrates the significance of the work carried out during the international Congresses from the last century to the present to reach a draft of the nomenclature codes in botany, zoology and bacteriology respectively with uniform general criteria. The identification of the species within the diversity of living creatures is the work of the scholar. On one hand he must gather the phenomenon and on the other attach a name to it (symbol) and a diagnosis. The Latin binomial is the name of the genus and of the species; the type-species helps to define the genus and determines its fundamental characteristics. The subdivision of the species (subspecies and infra-sub-specific divisions dictated by the various code and the distinction into populations in the language of genetics) is used for ulterior classification thus meeting the necessity expressed by the idea of intrinsic variability. The author developes certain concepts on the significance of the notation and scientific classification claiming that in these documents those characters of the phenomenon are presented which can be objects of analysis and measurement and not just abstract aspects, whether subjecttive or important for the observer. The task of applied genetics is different as in this science useful or nice characters (in vegetables, flowers, work or domestic animals) and the search for the production of useful substances (antibiotics etc. in the microbes) are deliberately sought in the population within the species. These considerations lead the author to examine the contribution made to science by systematics in studies on speciation and microevolution. In relation to the increase in knowledge and the new sciences evident between 1950 and 1980 the Linnaean system of classification returned as a subject of discussion particularly in the branch of bacteriology where morphological characters are of little help. The utilization of a greater number of characters and especially those based on genetics, physiology and pathology led to the consideration of new methods indicated by different names. The author gathers them together under the heading of Biosystematic. The criticism raised by the proposal for a so called numerical classification is examined, which recalls the principles stated by Adanson in the eighteenth century. According to the author, we are not dealing with a new classification but rather with a method, among the many others possible, which can be used preferably within the minor taxa (species and genera). This is still in the phase of elaboration and the author eriticises some of its applications to microorganisms (Actinomycetes) which were studied by him. He holds that these researches should be considered useful for the study of subspecific and specific subdivisions but must not replace the natural binomial based system of traditional systematics.
42556885|Trials were carried out in order to determine the reaction of inbred lines of maize to barley yellow dwarf virus (BYDV), both in the greenhouse and under field conditions, with natural and artificial inoculations. Four inbred lines showed heavy and typical symptoms of the disease, both in the greenhouse and in the field as well as a strong reaction to ELISA. The other four inbred lines that showed evident symptoms in the field were symptomless in the greenhouse in spite of their positive reaction to ELISA.Five inbred lines proved to be tolerant and one of them showed a certain level of resistance. Sono state effettuate prove tendenti a verificare il comportamento di alcune linee di mais nei confronti del virus del nanismo giallo dell'orzo (BYDV), su piante allevate in serra ed in pieno campo e con infezioni naturali ed artificiali. Si sono identificate quattro linee che manifestano sintomi tipici della malattia ed in elevata percentuale, sia in serra che in campo e che reagiscono positivamente al test ELISA. Altre quattro linee, che manifestano evidenti sintomi della malattia in campo, non hanno dato sintomi in serra, pur risultando affette da BYDV al test ELISA. Cinque linee di mais sono risultate invece tolleranti ed una di esse ha manifestato anche un certo grado di resistenza.

Il parassita si localizza, nella fase pi avanzata dell'infezione, nei vasi xilematici occludendoli con masse miceliche o microsclerozi. Prazmowski e B. cereus Frank, et Frank.) manifestano una buona attivit antagonistica nei confronti del patogeno. It was observed that the pathogenic attacks, already diffuse in all areas of oil seed production, begin at flowering time. The most susceptible hybrids are the first to be infected no matter what their growth stage. In the most advanced stage, of infection, the parasite is localized in the xylem vessels. Mycelial masses or sclerotia occlude the vessels. Laboratory tests have shown that some fungi and bacteria (Bacillus subtilis Cohn emend. Prazmowski and B. cereus Frank, et Frank.) show a strong antagonistic activity against the pathogen.

42556894|Transmission electron microscopy observations were carried out on leaves of tomato, cy Bonny Best, inoculated with the compatible race 1 of Fusarium oxysporum Schl., f. sp. lycopersici (Sacc.) Snyd. et Hans. Ultrastructural alterations became evident 10 days after inoculation (appearrance of external symptoms) and especially 17 days later (full expression of symptoms). The main changes observed included: i) regression of chloroplasts, i.e. dicrease of chloroplast size associated with some compression and distortion of thylakoids; ii) damage and disruption of cell membranes, especially tonoplast; iii) occurrence of vacuolar precipitates (single or aggregated globular bodies, often showing concentric structure); iv) cell necrosis with coagulation of the whole cell content. In vein (midrib) tissues, particularly in xylem parenchyma, cell necrosis was more frequent than in limb tissues. Increased electronopacity was observed in xylem cell walls; vessel walls were frequently lined with electron-opaque materials. None of such ultrastructural abnormalities, except some vessel linings, have been detected in leaves of plants artificially wilted by water shortage. Sono state effettuate osservazioni di microscopia elettronica a trasmissione in foglie di pomodoro, cv Bonny Best, inoculato con la razza 1 (compatibile) di Fusarium oxysporum Schl., f. sp. lycopersici (Sacc.) Snyd. et Hans. Le alterazioni ultrastrutturali, rilevate 10 giorni dopo Finoculazione (comparsa dei primi sintomi) e soprattutto a 17 giorni (sintomi completamente sviluppati), erano principalmente rappresentate da: i) regressione dei cloroplasti, che diminuivano di volume e mostravano compressione e deformazione dei tilacoidi; ii) lisi di membrane cellulari, specialmente del tonoplasto; iii) formazione di precipitati vacuolari, costituiti da globuli, singoli o aggregati, spesso carattenzzati da struttura concentrica; iv) necrosi di cellule, con coagulazione del loro contenuto. Nei tessuti della nervatura mediana, in particolare del parenchima xilematico, la necrosi cellulare era pi frequente che nella lamina mentre le pareti degli elementi xilematici adiacenti alle cellule necrotiche presentavano un sensibile aumento di opacit agli elettroni. Spesso, inoltre, le pareti dei vasi apparivano rivestite internamente da un sottile strato di materiale molto denso agli elettroni. Nessuna di queste alterazioni  stata in genere osservata in foglie di piante appassite per carenza idrica, che solo in qualche caso presentavano vasi con pareti rivestite da materiale denso.

42556900|The Authors have carried out an experiment to test the effect of concentration of inoculum of aecidiospores of Cronartium flaccidum on the production of uredia and telia on leaves of Vincetoxicum hirundinaria. The trials were carried out under controlled and field conditions. The best results is achieved with the concentration of 10,000 aecidiospores/ml in controlled conditions and of 100,000 aecidiospores/ml in field conditions. The youngest leaves are the most productive. We obtained the highest number of sori with inoculations made in the field conditions in the month of July. In conclusion, to have inoculum (basidiospores under controlled conditions) even if their germinative capacity is low, it is necessary to proceed with inoculations with suspension of 10,000 aecidiospores/ml, at night-day regime: 15-25C; 85-65% r.h.; 0-8,000 lux. However, in field conditions we have achieved positive results only in a period relating to natural production of sori (from June to September). Gli Autori hanno saggiato l'effetto della densit dell'inoculo (ecidiospore) di Cronartium flaccidum sulla produzione di uredo e teleuto sulle foglie di Vincetoxicum hirundinaria. Le esperienze sono state condotte in natura e in condizioni controllate: la concentrazione ottimale  stata, rispettivamente, di 100.000 e 10.000 ecidiospore/ml. Le foglie pi giovani sono le pi produttive. Infine, per avere basidiospore in condizioni controllate, occorre usare concentrazioni di 10.000 ecidiospore/ml con il regime seguente: 15-25C; 85-65% u.r.; 0-8.000 lux.

42556904|Using side by side different preparation techniques on samples for scanning electron microscopy an investigation was carried out on the initial phases of the infective process of Pseudomonas solanacearum in tomato seedling xylem vessels as well as its adherence and encapsulation by means of infiltration of tobacco plant leaves. In tomato seedlings two different modes of growth of the pathogen in the interior of the vessels were determined. In the first growth adheres to the vessel walls, while in the second it completely invades the lumen. In tobacco leaves P. solanacearum tends to adhere polarly to the plant cell surfaces and successively to become localized in preferential sites in the mesophyll. Of particular interest in both cases is the phenomenon of the coating of the bacterial cells. Utilizzando parallelamente tecniche diverse di allestimento dei campioni per la microscopia elettronica a scansione, sono state indgate le prime fasi del processo infettivo di Pseudomonas solanacearum in vasi xilematici di piantine di pomodoro e l'adesione e l'incapsulamento dello stesso inoculato per infiltrazione in foglie di tabacco. Nelle piantine di pomodoro sono state individuate due diverse modalit di crescita del patogeno all'interno dei vasi. Nella prima la crescita  aderente alla parete del vaso e nella seconda ne invade completamente il lume. Nelle foglie di tabacco si  individuata la tendenza di P. solanacearum a aderire polarmente alia superficie delle cellule vegetali e a localizzarsi successivamente in siti preferenziali del mesofillo. Particolare interesse in ambedue i casi  rivolto ai fenomeni di ricoprimento delle cellule batteriche.
42556905|E' stato indagato l'effetto di stress pr infezionali fisici (idrico, osmotico) e chimici (cloroformio, formaldeide, sodio salicilato, fusicoccina) diversi e del Phosethyl-Al sulla tracheofusariosi del pomodoro. La gravita della malattia, seguita fino a 19-22 giorni dopo l'inoculazione,  stata drasticamente ridotta in seguito ad esposizione delle radici per 3 min a vapori di cloroformio 24-96 h prima dell'inoculazione. Massimo effetto protettivo  stato ottenuto con intervalli fra trattamento e inoculazione di 48 o, in alcuni esperimenti, di 24 h. Trattamenti con cloroformio eseguiti subito prima dell'inoculazione (tempo 0) non hanno protetto. L'esposizione delle radici a vapori di formaldeide ha dato risultati scarsamente significativi e riproducibili. Sodio salicilato, fusicoccina e Phosethyl-AI non hanno protetto. La gravita della malattia  stata anche ridotta mediante stress idrici ed osmotici. Particularmente costante e significativo  risultato l'effetto dello stress osmotico (immersione delle radici per 90 min in mannitolo 0,5 M). Come nel caso della protezione esercitata da stress termici o da ferite (Anchisi et al., 1985), l'effetto protettivo dei trattamenti con cloroformio  stato attribuito ad induzione nell'ospite di modificazioni fisiologiche producenti uno stato di maggior resistenza dipendenti dal formarsi di lesioni in parte dei tessuti radicali. Un diverso meccanismo sembra essere azionato dagli stress idrico ed osmotico che proteggono senza apparentemente provocare danni cellulari irreversibili. The effect of preinfectional physical (water stress, osmotic stress) and chemical (chloroform, formaldehyde, Na-salycilate, fusicoccin) stresses and of Phosethyl-Al on Fusarium wilt of tomato was investigated. Disease severity, evaluated up to 19-22 days after the inoculation, was markedly reduced by root exposure for 3 min to chloroform vapors, 24-96 h before inoculation. Maximum protective effect was obtained with intervals of 48 or, in some experiments, 24 h between treatment and inoculation. Chloroform treatment made soon before inoculation (0 time) did not protect. Root exposure to formaldehyde vapors gave results scarcely significant and not easily reproducible. Na-salycilate, fusicoccin and Phosethyl-Al had no effect on the disease. Disease severity was also reduced by water and osmotic stresses. The osmotic stress (root immersion for 90 min in 0.5 mannitol) was more effective than the water stress. As in the case of the protection given by heat shocks (Anchisi et al., 1985) the protective effect of chloroform seems to depend on induction in the host of a state of higher resistance associated to physiological responses to cell injury. A different mechanism seems to be triggered by osmotic and water stresses, which apparently protect without causing irreversible cellular damage.
