The total dsRNA occurring in the European E13 isolate of Cryphonectria parasitica was utilized for cDNA synthesis performed with the two different oligonucleotide primer pairs (RSDS10-R2280 or RSDS10-RSDS11). Polymerase chain reaction (PCR) of the cDNAs gave two amplification products (about 1,450 b and 1,700 b) corresponding in size to those expected on the basis of the known sequences of the L-dsRNA sequence in EP713 strain of C. parasitica according to the primer pairs used (R4-R2280 or R3-R4080). The restriction profiles from each amplificate were compared with those expected from the L-dsRNA sequence in the EP713 strain, here utilized as the control. Most of the restriction enzymes did not reveal polymorphism between the E13 dsRNA sequences tested and the control. However, some restriction enzymes (Ace I, Bam H I, Eco R I and Sal I with the R4-R2280 product and Ace I with the R3-R4080 product) produced restriction profiles different from the control. The size of amplification products as well as their restriction patterns corresponded to the expected results according to the control sequences, confirming the specificity of the PCR products amplified. In addition some restriction enzymes revealed a polymorphism in the two sequences amplified from E13 dsRNA, showing the suitability of this method to detect possible genetic differences of the dsRNA conserved sequences harboured in hypovirulent field isolates of C. parasitica strains.
42555753|Mycoplasma-like organisms (MLOs) were detected by fluorescence (DAPI) and electron microscopy (TEM and SEM) in wild blackberry (Rubus fruticosus L.) affected by Rubus stunt disease and widespread in the Latium and Campania regions -Central and Southern Italy-. 42555754|In our previous paper, SDS-dissociated proteins from eight genotypes representing pathogenic and nonpathogenic strains of Fusarium oxysporum were assessed and compared using poly aery lamide gel electrophoresis. In this study, reproducible differences in protein profiles among nonpathogens (strains C5 and C14) were observed. Further characterization of pathogenic and nonpathogenic strains of F. oxysporum were evaluated by isozyme analyses and native protein electrophoresis. Data were consistent in revealing distinctive differences in protein banding patterns and zymograms between strains C5 and C14. Similarity in protein profile between strain C5 and F. oxysporum f. sp. cucumerinum, causal agent of Fusarium wilt of cucumber, may indicate it overlaps towards the pathogenic form, as indicated from previous studies. However, despite repeated attempts, no banding pattern or zymograms unique to pathogenicity were observed. Isozyme analyses have shown to be a valuable tool to examine the genetic variation in closely-related species and strains within the genus Fusarium and is recommended to be used in addition to greenhouse pathogenicity tests for selection and characterization of biocontrol agents. 42555755|Thin sectioning and electron microscopy showed that mycoplasmalike organisms (MLOs) were associated with a severe disease of lettuce grown in plastic tunnels in Liguria, northern Italy. These and other tests gave no evidence of viral or fungal infection. By immunoelectron microscopy and ELISA, the associated MLOs were identified as a strain or strains of European aster yellows (EAY) MLO. When periwinkles were inoculated with the MLOs by the leafhopper vector, the majority of plants developed symptoms typical of EAY but there was some variation, suggesting the presence of mixed populations of MLOs. Seven isolates showing two symptom variants were therefore selected, propagated in periwinkle, and further studied. Southern hybridization experiments using a cloned DNA fragment from EAY MLO confirmed that the genomes of all seven isolates contained nucleotide sequences closely related or identical to those of EAY MLOs, but some isolates showed a hybridization pattern more similar to that of chrysanthemum yellows MLO than to that typical of EAY MLO. We conclude that the original field-infected lettuce plants may have contained both these types of MLOs Nell'Ottobre 1991  stata rilevata, in Liguria, una grave malattia su lattuga coltivata in ambiente protetto. 42555762|The effect of allopurinol [4-hydroxypyrazolo(3,4-d)pyrimidine], an analogue of purine and a tightly binding inhibitor of xanthine oxidoreductase, was investigated to evaluate its potential for interfering with the expression of the hypersensitive response incited by tobacco necrosis virus (TNV) infection in tobacco leaves. In contrast with previous results, showing that allopurinol was not effective in inhibiting both local necrotic response associated with hypersensitivity induced by tobacco mosaic virus (TMV) and systemic veinal necrotic symptoms associated with infection by a veinal necrotic strain of potato virus Y(PVYN), when allopurinol was applied to tobacco plants by root absorption from a 400 M solution for 10 days before inoculation it proved to be effective in preventing the formation of necrotic lesions induced by TNV infection. The amount of virus detected in TNV-infected allopurinoltreated leaves was also very low but, particularly in cv. Samsun NN, higher than expected in relation to the very strong decrease in lesion formation. This was probably because in leaves of allopurinol-treated plants virus replication is not always accompanied by production of macroscopically-visible necrotic lesions. However, possible induction of subliminal infections cannot be excluded. The present results seem to indicate that allopurinol treatment affects TNV-induced necrotic lesion formation mainly by reducing the injectable sites and/or interfering with the viral infection process. A certain influence on the establishment of the necrotic process by the inhibition of Superoxide-producing activity of tobacco xanthine oxidase seems likely. However, these preliminary results give no clear cut information about the mechanism by which allopurinol exerts this inhibitory effect. The results are consistent with the hypothesis that the interference exerted by allopurinol in purine and probably also pyrimidine catabolism may be a key point for constituting an altered metabolic status in the host cell and this could make the virus unable to accomplish its biological functions (infection and/or replication and/or movement), prerequisites for induction of the hypersensitive response expression. L'allopurinolo [4-idrossipirazolo(3,4-d)pirimidina], analogo strutturale delle purine e specifico inibitore della xantina ossidoreduttasi, somministrato per via radicale a piante di tabacco 10 giorni prima dell'inoculazione in soluzione 400 M,  risultato in grado di interferire con Tespressione dell'ipersensibilit indotta dal virus della necrosi del tabacco (TNV). Questo fenomeno  in contrasto con precedenti risultati dove invece il trattamento con allopurinolo non  risultato efficace nell'inibire la formazione delle lesioni necrotiche locali prodotte da TMV e la necrosi nervale associata all'infezione di un ceppo necrotico del PVY. La quantit di virus riscontrata nelle foglie trattate con allopurinolo ed inoculate con TNV era molto bassa ma, particolarmente nella cv. Samsun NN, piu elevata di quanto poteva far supporre lo scarso numero di lesioni necrotiche present. Ci probabilmente perch nelle foglie trattate con allopurinolo la replicazione del virus non  sempre accompagnata dalla produzione di lesioni necrotiche visibili macroscopicamente. Tuttavia non pu essere escluso che in qualche misura venga indotto un tipo d'infezione subliminale. I risultati ottenuti, nel loro complesso sembrano indicare che la riduzione del numero di lesioni necrotiche nelle foglie delle piante trattate sia in relazione alla diminuzione dei siti d'infezione e/o all'interferenza dell'allopurinolo col processo infettivo del virus. Inoltre una certa influenza sembra essere esercitata anche a carico del processo necrotico, probabilmente attraverso l'inibizione della produzione di superossido associata all'attivit della xantina ossidasi delle foglie di tabacco. Questi risultati preliminari non forniscono tuttavia informazioni sul meccanismo attraverso il quale l'allopurinolo inibisce l'espressione dell'ipersensibilit provocata dal TMV su tabacco. E' possibile ipotizzare che l'alterazione del metabolismo delle purine e forse anche delle pirimidine indotto dall'allopurinolo nella cellula ospite possa essere un evento fondamentale in grado di interferire con le funzioni biologiche del virus (infezione e/o replicazione e/o movimento) e quindi con l'induzione della reazione d'ipersensibilit.
42555763|The virulent strain E4 of Cryphonectria parastica (Murr.) Barr was transformed to hygromycin B resistance by using the vector pHRC12, which contains the bacterial hygromycin B phosphotransferase gene (hph) fused to promoter elements of the Aspergillus nidulans trpC gene. Southern hybridizations of transformants confirmed the integration of the gene in the genome of the fungus. Transformants T2T4 with tandem integration of the hph gene lost the resistance to hygromycin B (HygB) in vitro when serially transferred on nonselective media, while transformant T1, in which the gene was integrated in multiple sites, was mitotically stable. In vivo mitotic stability was lost for all the strains after 12 months from inoculation with the exception of T1 which maintained the resistance to HygB. Transformation with the hph gene did not alter the morphology of the fungus, its growth rate on nonselective medium, or virulence. Transformants of E4 were completely vegetatively compatible with each other and with the untransformed E4 strain. Conversion of the T1 transformant by dsRNA was obtained and expression of HygB resistance was not down-regulated by the presence of the dsRNA virus. Mediante anastomosi ifale con il ceppo ipovirulento E13  stata ottenuta la conversione del trasformato T1. La presenza di dsRNA nei ceppi convertiti non ha modificato La resistenza a HygB.

42555765|Veinal necrosis induced by a potato Y virus isolate (PVY-nnp) in "Bahamian Hot Chile" and "Anaheim F6" pepper varieties is associated with the production of several pathogenesisrelated (PR) proteins. 42555759|Nelle interazioni pianta-microrganismo il riconoscimento cellulare  determinato da riconoscimenti molecolari tra i ligandi del microrganismo e i recettori vegetali. I modelli sul meccanismo di resistenza alla malattia prevedono la presenza nella pianta dei geni del riconoscimento, che interagiscono con i prodotti dei geni di avirulenza del patogeno, e dei geni di risposta che, attivati solo in seguito al riconoscimento, determinano l'espressione di alcuni aspetti dell'intera risposta di resistenza. I lavori pioneristici di Flor negli anni '30 hanno portalo all'ipotesi gene-per-gene, secondo cui il prodotto del gene di resistenza trasforma il segnale che porta al riconoscimento della presenza del patogeno con la successiva attivazione di complessi sistemi di difesa biochimie i e strutturali. In seguito, sono stati proposti modelli molecolari basati sul riconoscimento complementare, del tipo "tutto o nulla", tra molecole segnale (elicitori) del patogeno e molecole recettrici della pianta ospite analogamente a quanto avviene neisistemi ormone-recettore delle cellule animali. Dell'ipotesi gene-per-gene sono state date interpretazioni fisiologiche sintetizzate in modelli sul meccanismo di interazione ospite-patogeno. Nel modello elicitore-recettore, elicitori specifici, codificati dai geni di avirulenza, sono riconosciuti dai recettori dell'ospite, codificati dai geni di resistenza, e in seguito a tale legame si innescherebbe una difesa generalizzata dell'ospite. Nel modello del dimero, la formazione di dimeri tra i prodotti proteiciprimari dei geni di resistenza e di quelli di avirulenza considerata la causa dell'incompatibilit di tipo gene-per-gene. Infine, nel modello del canale ionico, l'elaborazione del segnale sarebbe dovuta a flussi di elettroliti e in particolare di ioni calcio. Una chiave per comprendere le basi molecolari della patogenicit batterica e la specificit dell'ospite  la produzione e il coinvolgimento di segnali di riconoscimento che avviano le risposte di difesa della pianta tra le quali la risposta ipersensibile (HR)  considerata una manifestazione del riconoscimento e della resistenza. L'applicazione delle tecniche di biologia molecolare sta rivoluzionando lo studio delle interazioni pianta-patogeno rendendo possibili analisi decisive per suffragare determinate ipotesi e per chiarire i meccanismi biochimici che regolano fenomeni quali la virulenza nei patogeni e la resistenza nelle piante. Per quanto riguarda i meccanismi responsabili della resistenza delle piante alle malattie un notevole contributo potr derivare dalla clonazione e caratterizzazione dei geni di resistenza in diverse piante superiori. In plant-microbe interactions cellular recognition is determined by a series of molecular recognitions between microrganism ligands and plant receptors. According to the models on plant disease resistance, the plant is equipped with two types of genes. First, recognition genes which interact with the avirulence genes products. Second, response genes which, activated after recognition, are responsible for the expression of many aspects of resistance response. Detailed genetic analysis of plant-pathogen interactions has shown a gene-for-gene interaction. That is, resistance or susceptibility in host cultivars to distinguish between physiological races of a pathogen is determined by pairs of corresponding genes in the host and pathogen. According to this hypothesis, firstly elaborated by Flor in the 1930s, the resistance gene product transduces the pathogen signal allowing its recognition with the activation of complex biochemical and structural defence mechanisms. In the following years, molecular models, essentially based on complementary recognition between pathogen elicitor and host receptor, have been proposed in analogy with the hormone-receptor systems of the animal cells. The most accreditated models to explain the molecular basis of recognition in gene-forgene systems are discussed in this review. As for the elicitor-receptor model, specific elicitors, encoded by avirulence genes, are recognized by host receptors, encoded by resistance genes, and as a consequence of that complementary binding, a generalized host defence is triggered. In the dimer model, the generation of dimers between primary protein products of resistance genes and avirulence genes is considered the cause of gene-for-gene incompatibility. Finally, in the ion-channel model the signal transduction is due to electrolyte fluxes and, in particular, by the calcium ion, which is known to control a wide array of cellular responses. A key to understanding the molecular basis for bacterial pathogenecity and host specificity is the production and deployment of recognition signals. Indeed, they are hypothesized to trigger the plant difence responses such as the hypersensitive respose (HR) that is considered the expression of the recognition and resistance. Nevertheless, the biological functions of the majority of pathogenicity genes, identified and characterized by molecular biology, are still not clear, there is an increasing optimism supported by recent experimental evidences. From several phytopathogenic bacteria hrp gene clusters have been isolated and their phenotipic expression in heterologous bacteria is a powerful tool to study the formation and secretion mechanisms of the postulated recognition signal. The HR elicitor, named harpin and isolated from Erwinia amylovora and P. syringae pv. syringae, plays an essential role both on the disease and in the plant defence responses. Moreover, recent studies support the hypothesis of the harpin universality in the phytopathogenic bacteria inducing HR in nonhost plant. The application of molecular genetic has deeply changed the study of plant-pathogen interactions providing decisive tests of hypotheses and sheding light on the biochemical mechanisms underlying these e vents such as the virulence in the pathogens and the resistance in the plants. The cloning and characterization of resistance genes from several higher plants are likely to permit a greater understanding of the mechanisms behind plant disease resistance in the near future.
42555776|Free amino acids profiles of cell lysates and extracellular cellulolytic and pectolytic enzyme activities of pathogenic and nonpathogenie strains of Fusarium oxysporum were employed as chemo- and bio-taxonomic criteria. Particular nonprotein amino acids were found to be a unique feature of the profile of each strain, especially the nonpathogenic strains (C5 and C14). Amino acid profiles from host-closely related strains revealed a higher degree of homogeneity when compared with host-distinctly related strains. Comparing extracellular cellulolytic and pectolytic enzymatic activities, in the context to separate among morphologically-similar strains, concluded similar and consistent results. However, despite repeated trials, no amino acid or enzymatic pattern unique to pathogenicity and virulence were detected. Thus, these finding, confirm and extend the previous information in supporting the contention that variations are distinct enough to separate between strains C5 and C14 into biologically different genotypes. Our data accordingly suggest the potential use of thin layer chromatography as a reliable tool in clary fing the overlaps and confirming genetic affinity in strains of F. oxysporum grouped by morphological characters. I profili degli aminoacidi liberi dei lisati cellulari e le attivit degli enzimi cellulolitici e pectolitici sono stati usati come criteri chemo e bio-tassonomici su ceppi patogeni e non di Fusarium oxysporum. Un profilo caratteristico degli aminoacidi non proteici  stato riscontrato in ciascun ceppo studiato, specialmente per quelli non patogeni (C5 e C14). Tuttavia i profili ottenuti da ceppi isolati dalla stessa specie vegetale mostrano grado di omogeneit pi elevato rispetto a quelli relativi a ceppi provenienti da ospiti tassonomicamente differenti. Analoghi risultati sono stati ottenuti comparando le attivit cellulolitiche e pectolitiche extracellulari. Comunque, nonostante le ripetute prove, non sono stati individuati aminoacidi o profili enzimatici caratteristici per la patogenicit e virulenza. I risultati confermano la separazione, gi emersa precedentemente, dei ceppi C5 e C14 in due genotipi biologicamente differenti. Viene pertanto suggerito l'impiego della cromatografia su strato sottile quale strumento per verificare eventuali affinit genetiche tra ceppi di F. oxysporum precedentemente raggruppati sulla base di caratteri morfologici.

42555778|In order to characterize the genetic variability of dsRNA in several Cryphonectria parasitica strains isolated in eastern Sicily from chestnut plants recovering from blight, two sequences corresponding to part of ORFA and ORFB were investigated by polymerase chain reaction (PCR) and restriction fragment length polymorphism (RFLP) analysis of amplified products. I risultati dimostrano la specificit del protocollo di PCR e la omogeneit elevata di queste sequenze amplifcate. 42555768|La forma tipica della Flavescenza dorata della vite (FD sensu stricto)  presente, oltre che nella Francia meridionale, anche nel nord Italia (Lombardia e Veneto). Al fine di avere indicazioni sul comportamento della malattia in condizioni naturali, sono stati eseguiti rilevamenti dettagliati per sei anni consecutivi (1988-1993) in un vigneto di Chardonnay colpito da FD e mai trat tato con insetticidi. I risultati dei rilevamenti hanno messo in evidenza che nel corso dei 6 anni di osservazione l'incidenza della malattia  variata dal 52,4 al 68,3 % e che i casi di "guarigione" e di "reinfezione", tipici della FD, erano pi o meno in una situazione di equilibrio. Durante tutto il periodo di osservazione 97 viti non hanno mai evidenziato sintomi di FD. Poich studi effettuati in Francia sembravano indicare che viti infette da nepovirus fossero meno suscettibili alla malattia, le viti sopracitate e, per controllo, 20 viti che avevano sempre manifestato sintomi gravi di FD e 20 che invece avevano evidenziato solo sintomi lievi durante tutto il periodo di osservazione, sono state esaminate con il metodo ELISA per rilevare la presenza dei nepovirus GFLV, ArMV, SLRV. Inoltre, sono stati presi in considerazione anche alcuni closterovirus (GLRaV-1, -2, -3, -5) e il fleck (GFkV) in quanto, come i fitoplasmi, hanno localizzazione floematica. I risultati di queste ricerche sembrano escludere qualsiasi tipo di protezione svolta dalle infezioni virali nei confronts della FD. Nel 1994 il numero delle viti che non hanno mai manifestato sintomi di FD si  ridotto a 84; queste viti saranno tenute sotto osservazione al fine di individuare eventuali biotipi resistenti tolleranti alla FD. Flavescence dore (FD) is a grapevine yellows caused by phytoplasmas which is present in southern France and northern Italy (Lombardia and Veneto). Detailed inspections were conducted during 6 years (1988-1993) in September in a vineyard of cv Chardonnay located in the viticultural area of Oltrep pavese (Lombardia). The vineyard, planted in 1982 with 901 standard material vines, began to show FD symptoms few years after plantation and was never treated with insecticides. The investigations showed that the rate of symptomatic plants ranged from 52,4 to 68,3% during the 6 years of observations. Furthermore, "recovery" and "reinfection", typical phenomena of FD disease, resulted nearly balanced. During the six years of field observations 97 vines never showed FD symptoms. Since previous studies carried out in France seem to indicate that vines infected with nepoviruses are less susceptible to FD, the above mentioned vines and, for control, 20 vines that show severe symptoms each years and 20 vines with mild symptoms during the same period, were tested by ELISA for nepoviruses (GFLV, ArMV, SLRV) infections. In addiction, closteroviruses (GLRaV-1, -2, -3,-5) and fleck (GFkV) were also tested because of their phloematic localization. The results of these studies seem to show that no protection is developed by virus infection against FD. Indeed, the vines that never show symptoms of FD resulted to be infected by viruses in lower percentage in comparison with FD infected vines. In 1994 the number of the vines that never showed FD symptoms was reduced to 84. These vines will be maintained under observation in order to individuate possible tolerant or resistant vines.
42555769|Vesiculated mitochondria (VM) induced by grapevine leafroll-associated viruses, GLRaV-1 and GLRaV-3 in phloem parenchyma cells of naturally infected grapevine plants have been cytochemically and immunocytochemically investigated to assess their role in the infection process of these phloem-limited viruses, putative members of the closterovirus genus. In parenchyma phloem cells of in vitro grown plants mitochondria showing different stages of vesiculation were associated with numerous virus filaments and aggregates of granular electron-dense material. The single-membraned vesicles characterizing VM contained a finely stranded material that was removed by digestion with RNase from Aspergillus clavatus but not after treatments with DNase I or proteinase K indicating that it is mainly composed of RNA. On the contrary, the granular electron-dense aggregates were removed from the sections only by proteinase K, therefore they are protein inclusions. Labelling with RNase-gold, besides confirming the nature of the vesicle content, showed that also virus particles were specifically labelled by the probe, though labelling intensity was lower than that obtained with antibodies against virus coat protein. The same antibodies did not label the granular electron-dense material in the citoplasm. All these data strongly suggest that VM are involved in the replication of the viral RNA and that the granular electron-dense material is a virus-codified protein, but not the coat protein. Moreover RNase-gold has proved to be an alternative method for the identification of virus particles on thin sections when specific antibodies are not available or in the case of multiple infections with different closteroviruses. Sono state condotte delle indagini citochimiche ed immunocitochimiche per verificare il ruolo dei mitocondri vescicolati (VM) in piante infette con i closterovirus associati all'accartocciamento fogliare della vite, GLRaV-1 e GLRaV-3. Nelle cellule parenchimatiche del floema di piante di vite coltivate in vitro i mitocondri in vari stadi di vescicolazione erano associati a particelle di virus e aggregati di materiale elettrondenso. Le vescicole prodotte nei VM contenevano materiale fibrillare che appariva rimosso dopo digestione con RNasi ma non in seguito a trattamento con DNasi I o proteasi K. Quest'ultima era invece in grado di digerire il materiale elettrondenso nel citoplasma rivelandone la natura proteica. La marcatura con RNasi coniugata con oro colloidale, oltre a confermare che il contenuto delle vescicole  costituito da RNA, ha evidenziato che anche le particelle virali vengono marcate specificamente dal complesso enzima-oro, anche se la marcatura era meno intensa di quella ottenuta con anticorpi contro la proteina del capside virale usati come controllo. Quest'ultimi non hanno tuttavia marcato il materiale elettrondenso presente nel citoplasma. Questi risultati indicano che i VM sono coinvolti nella replicazione dell'RNA virale e che il materiale elettrondenso potrebbe essere una proteina codificata dal virus, ma non la proteina del capside. Infine il complesso Rnasi-oro colloidale si  rivelato utile nella localizzazione delle particelle virali e pertanto pu essere usato in alternativa agli anticorpi quando questi non siano disponibili o nel frequente caso di infezioni multiple con pi closterovirus.
42555770|Young grapevine plants originated from virus-free clones of the cultivars Barbera and Pinot noir and from the hybrid LN-33 were inoculated by green grafting with grapevine sources infected only with grapevine leafroll-associated virus 1 (GLRaV-1) or with grapevine le afroll-associated virus 3 (GLRaV-3). Green grafting was successfu in most cases, and both GLRaV-1 and GLRaV-3 were capable of causing leafroll symptoms in inoculated vines. Therefore the two viruses can be considered as causal agents of the grapevine leafroll disease and can be named "grapevine leafroll virus 1" (GLRV-1) and "grapevine leafroll virus 3" (GLRV-3) respectively. Al fine di verificare se i closterovirus GLRaV-1 (grapevine leafroll associated virus 1) e GLRaV-3 (grapevine leafroll associated virus 3) sono in grado di determinare la sindrome nota come "accartocciamento fogliare della vite", giovani piante di cloni virus-esenti di Barbera, Pinot e LN-33 sono state inoculate per innesto erbaceo con fonti pure dell'uno o dell'altro virus. Nella gran parte dei casi in prova l'innesto  attecchito e sia GLRaV-1 che GLRaV-3 hanno provocato sintomi tipici di accartocciamento fogliare nelle viti indicatrici nelle quali erano stati inoculati. Pertanto i due virus suddetti sono da considerare agenti causali dell'accartocciamento fogliare della vite e possono essere rispettivamente denominati "virus 1 dell'accartocciamento fogliare della vite" (GLRV-1) e "virus 3 dell'accartocciamento fogliare della vite" (GLRV-3).
42555771|Vengono descritte le caratteristiche fondamentali di due modelli epidemici applicati a Plasmopara viticola, PRO (Plasmopara Risk Oppenheim) e EPI (Etat Potentiel d'Infection) Plasmopara. In Pro il ciclo del patogeno viene suddiviso in varie fasi per ognuna delle quali vengono definite le condizioni necessarie e sufficienti; la progressione epidemica viene simulata attraverso la moltiplicazione del numero di macchie d'olio presenti per un coefficiente che dipende dal numero degli sporangi formati e dalle modalit di dispersione. EPI Plasmopara prende in considerazione il sistema clima - patogeno - pianta nella sua globalit, includendovi anche il periodo di svernamento, considerato fondamentale per l'evoluzione epidemica successiva. Il rischio di danno cui  sottoposta la vite viene simulato confrontando le condizioni climatiche attuali con le medie della zona considerata. Le discrepanze tra situazione reale e simulazione vengono attribuite per quanto riguarda PRO all'inaccuratezza nella definizione dei vari comparti e, per EPI, alle difficolt di giungere ad una esauriente definizione delle leggi che regolano il comportamento del sistema considerato. Two epidemic models applied to Plasmopara viticola, PRO (Plasmopara Risk Oppenheim) and EPI (Etat Potentiel d'Infection) Plasmopara are described. In PRO, the cycle of P. viticola is divided in various phases: infection, incubation, sporulation, inoculum dispersion; climatic conditions required for each phase are defined. Primary infections occur according to the three ten rule and epidemic simulation is carried out by multiplying the number of sporulating lesions by a coefficient depending on the number of sporangia and climatic conditions during the dispersion phase. EPI Plasmopara simulation concerns the evolution of the whole system climate - pathogen - plant. Oospore overwintering is taken into account and plays an important role in the epidemic process. EPI hypothizes an adaptation of the pathogen to the climatic conditions of the considered zone; therefore epidemic simulation is based on the comparison between the actual and average climatic conditions. Unreliability in some PRO simulations seems to be due to the inaccurate definition of the conditions required for the various phases of the P. viticola cycle. In particular more detailed informations are needed on the determinism of primary infections and on the influence of numerous primary foci on the epidemic evolution. Suitable simulations are given by EPI both in absence of disease or for very serious epidemics; on the contrary, moderate risk is not sufficiently indicated by the model.
42555772|Ozone is one of the most studied air pollutants and it may have not only direct negative effects on the plants, but also an indirect influence on plant/pathogen relationships. These indirect effects may result in an enhanced or reduced virulence of the pathogen, as well as in a modified defence response of the plant. The results of the studies about ozone and plant-pathogen interactions may contribute to a correct evaluation of both the direct and indirect effects of the pollutant on crop yield, and may elucidate the plant defence mechanisms activated in response to the pathogens or, more generally, to the stress factors. The plant defence reactions evoked by pathogen attack may, on the other hand, modify the severity of ozone injury, and this make more difficult the understanding of the mechanisms involved in the interactions amongst the plant, the pathogen and the air pollutant. This review gives a survey of the more recent literature on this topic and suggests some critical considerations about the effects of ozone on plant-pathogen interactions. L'ozono rappresenta uno tra gli inquinanti atmosferici attualmente pi studiati. Esso, oltre ad avere diretti effetti negativi sulle piante, pu interferire con la interazione pianta/patogeno. Tale interferenza pu risultare in una stimolazione o in una riduzione della virulenza del patogeno e/o delle capacita difensive della pianta. Studi relativi a tale interferenza prospettano un grande interesse perch consentono sia la corretta valutazione degli effetti anche indiretti dell'inquinante sulla produttivit delle piante sia la comprensione dei meccanismi di difesa che la pianta attiva verso i patogeni o, pi in generale, verso i fattori di stress. Nel contempo, le reazioni di difesa scatenate nella pianta dall'aggressione del patogeno possono modificare l'incidenza del danno da ozono, a conferma della complessit dei meccanismi coinvolti che non sono sempre di facile interpretazione. Questo lavoro costituisce un'aggiornata rassegna dei dati disponibili a livello internazionale su tale problematica e si propone di valutare criticamente, alla luce delle pi recenti acquisizioni, gli effetti dell'ozono sulle interazioni pianta-patogeno.
